title: About Thi Lan Anh Tran
text:
I’m a student in ETC5523 – Communicating with Data at Monash University, focused on turning complex datasets into clear stories that help people make better decisions. I work primarily in R (tidyverse) with Quarto and GitHub for fully reproducible analysis.
My current interests include: - Data wrangling & visualisation (ggplot2, plotly, shiny for interactive explainers)
- Evidence storytelling for social & economic questions
- Reproducible research (Quarto sites, parameterised reports, clean project structure)
I value communication that is visually clean, statistically honest, and audience-appropriate.



Email: ttra0169@student.monash.edu

GitHub: @ttra0196

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/

title: About Thi Lan Anh Tran
text:
What I’m learning now

Building Quarto websites and blogs with cross-references, citations, and publishing to GitHub Pages

Using shiny to demonstrate statistical ideas interactively (e.g., coin-flip probabilities, confidence intervals)

Designing plots and tables for fast comprehension and accessibility

title: About Thi Lan Anh Tran
text:
Selected skills

Languages & tools: R, tidyverse, ggplot2, plotly, shiny, Quarto, Git, GitHub

Workflow: clean project structure, literate programming, reproducibility, data ethics

Communication: audience-first writing, figure/table design, executive summaries

title: About Thi Lan Anh Tran
text:
Beyond study
I enjoy music, playing LEGO, and exploring creative ways to explain complex ideas simply.

text: This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!
